item.title: core文件
item.description: 1.ulimit -c unlimited 2./proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern 2.或者/etc/sysctl.conf中添加kernel.core_pattern=core_%e_%p或sysctl -w kernel.core_pattern=core_%e_%p 3.查看/etc/security/limits.conf * soft core unlimited //所有用户 <user-login-id> soft core unlimited //设置某个用户 还有hard core需要考虑$sysctl -a|grep core_pattern kernel.core_pattern = |/usr/libexec/abrt-hook-ccpp /var/cache/abrt %p %s %u %c “abrtd” creates a sub-directory (named something like “ccpp-1279914365-14618”) in the directory “/var/cache/abrt” as shown in the value of the variable. This also means that the core files will also be stored in that sub-directory in the “/var/cache/abrt” directory (in addition to the current directory where application was run).
